title: 104_hr3278
content: The conveyance of Saint Helena Island Light Station is discussed in Section 1. The Secretary of Transportation will convey the Saint Helena Island Light Station property to the Great Lakes Lighthouse Keepers Association without payment, subject to appropriate terms and conditions. The conveyance of the Saint Helena Island Light Station property to the Great Lakes Lighthouse Keepers Association is subject to conditions ensuring its use for maritime history interpretation, Coast Guard aid to navigation, and compliance with the National Historic Preservation Act. Maintenance of navigation functions is also required. The United States will continue to operate and maintain the lighthouse equipment on the property conveyed for navigation purposes. The Great Lakes Lighthouse Keepers Association cannot interfere with the navigation aids without permission. The US reserves the right to relocate or make changes to the Saint Helena Island Light Station as needed. The US also has the right to enter the property for maintenance of the navigation aids. The United States retains easement access to the property for maintaining navigational aids. The Saint Helena Island Light Station reverts to the US for national security purposes. The Great Lakes Lighthouse Keepers Association must maintain the station according to preservation laws. The Keepers Association is not obligated to maintain aid to navigation equipment at the Saint Helena Island Light Station in Michigan. The term "Saint Helena Island Light Station" refers to the Coast Guard property in Mackinac County, Moran Township, excluding historical artifacts like lenses or lanterns.
